column4: where can I find a list of packages which are installed by Ubuntu Gutsy by default?
synaptic
where in synaptic?
menu > system > admin>synaptic package manager.
yeah... I know where it is .. but how do I see a list of all the packages which are installed by Ubuntu Gutsy on first install?
reason is that I think I uninstalled a package which I should not have
Don't know, I'm running Dapper. Just re-install your app with Synaptic, and it should grab the missing package.
I am not sure which package it was which I should not have installed... I uninstalled a number of them
actually all I need to know is which package deals with sound capture in Ubuntu
Everyone should have a notebook, and keep track of what they do, so you can backtrack stuff like this. zetheroo, try reinstalling alsa?
ok will try
Good luck.
I lost my link to it, but Google for the "Rute Manual"
everything you wanted to know about linux, plus some.
you want to play on the command line, right?
whoops, wrong ze*
why format before a new install?
hotdog, and why install? shouldn't apt-get upgrade work?
ok, do you leave /home alone? If not, what is your backup and restore routine?
ok, what are you using to move your files/archives around? I'm trying to figure out a good backup/restore system for my LAN here.
ok, so have you tried to do a restore? I found that it is the "less" part that kills you doing a restore. Missing, broken links, etc.. are a PITA to fix.
